TITLE_UR: دونوں جہان تیری محبت میں ہار کے
TITLE_EN: Donon Jahan Teri Mohabbat Mein Haar Ke
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: One of Faiz's most celebrated ghazals featuring the famous opening line 'دونوں جہان تیری محبت میں ہار کے'. The poem blends romantic love with existential sacrifice. The radif 'کے' is used with multiple qaafiya words. The final couplet (maqta) includes the poet's signature 'فیضؔ' [citation:6].

TITLE_UR: آپ کی یاد آتی رہی رات بھر
TITLE_EN: Aap Ki Yaad Aati Rahi Raat Bhar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A masterpiece of nocturnal longing with the powerful opening line 'آپ کی یاد آتی رہی رات بھر' and the refrain 'رات بھر' (all night). Each couplet presents a different image of night-time suffering - moonlight, candle, fragrance, breeze, door chains.

TITLE_UR: نہیں نگاہ میں منزل تو جستجو ہی سہی
TITLE_EN: Nahin Nigah Mein Manzil To Justaju Hi Sahi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal with the resilient refrain 'ہی سہی' (let it be). The final couplet is particularly famous for its reference to 'دیار غیر' (foreign land) and 'ذکر وطن' (mention of homeland), reflecting Faiz's experience of exile and imprisonment.

TITLE_UR: مجھ سے پہلی سی محبت مری محبوب نہ مانگ
TITLE_EN: Mujh Se Pehli Si Mohabbat Meri Mehboob Na Maang
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: This is perhaps Faiz's most famous poem, marking his ideological shift from personal romance to political revolution. Written after the Rawalpindi Conspiracy Case, it juxtaposes personal love with the suffering of humanity [citation:1][citation:3][citation:5].

TITLE_UR: تنہائی کا سفر ہے تنہائی کی منزل
TITLE_EN: Tanhai Ka Safar Hai Tanhai Ki Manzil
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: An existential ghazal exploring the theme of absolute loneliness. The poet reaches a state where even the self and its sorrows cease to exist. The repetition of 'ہم' (we/us) and its gradual negation creates a powerful effect of self-annihilation.

TITLE_UR: شام فراق اب نہ پوچھ آئی اور آ کے ٹل گئی
TITLE_EN: Sham-e-Firaq Ab Na Puchh Aai Aur Aa Ke Tal Gayi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Gulon Mein Rang Bhare / Nuskha Hai Wafa (Pg. 245)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Written at Jinnah Hospital, Karachi in 1953. This ghazal appears in 'Gulon Mein Rang Bhare' and 'Nuskha Hai Wafa'. The translation by Agha Shahid Ali captures the essence of this masterpiece [citation:2].

TITLE_UR: دل ناامید تو نہیں ناکام ہی تو ہے
TITLE_EN: Dil Na-Umeed To Nahin Nakam Hi To Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: The first couplet 'دل ناامید تو نہیں ناکام ہی تو ہے' is one of Faiz's most quoted verses. It appears in multiple collections and represents his philosophical resilience in the face of adversity [citation:6].

TITLE_UR: گلون میں رنگ بھرے باد نوبہار چلے
TITLE_EN: Gulon Mein Rang Bhare Baad-e-Nau Bahar Chale
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Naqsh-e-Faryadi (1941)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A beautiful spring-themed ghazal from Faiz's first collection 'Naqsh-e-Faryadi' (1941), representing his early romantic period before his political activism fully emerged [citation:9].

TITLE_UR: ہم جو تاریک راہوں میں مارے گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Tareek Rahon Mein Mare Gaye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Zindan Nama (1956)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Written during Faiz's imprisonment, this poem reflects the experience of political prisoners. The Library of Congress has audio recordings of Faiz reciting his poetry, including works from 'Zindan Nama' [citation:4][citation:9].

TITLE_UR: یہ داغ داغ اجالا یہ شب گزیدہ سحر
TITLE_EN: Ye Daagh Daagh Ujla Ye Shab Gazida Seher
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A revolutionary ghazal using the imagery of a stained dawn to symbolize the struggle for freedom. The poem reflects Faiz's ability to weave political commentary into classical ghazal forms.

TITLE_UR: آج بازار میں پا بہ جولاں چلو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Bazaar Mein Pa Bih Jolan Chalo
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang (1965)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A joyful ghazal with a revolutionary spirit, from the collection 'Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang' (1965). The poem encourages marching forward despite oppression.

TITLE_UR: نظر انداز ہم کو جاں سے کیا
TITLE_EN: Nazar Andaz Hum Ko Jaan Se Kiya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the paradox of finding light in the memory of the beloved amidst darkness. Featured in various anthologies of Faiz's work.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے مانا کہ تم سے کچھ نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Mana Ke Tum Se Kuchh Na Mila
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about finding pleasure in desire itself, even when unfulfilled. Explores the theme of satisfaction in longing. From Faiz's middle period.

TITLE_UR: کتنی ناداں تھی محبت ہماری
TITLE_EN: Kitni Nadan Thi Mohabbat Hamari
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal reflecting on the innocence of first love. Represents Faiz's early romantic style before his full turn to political poetry.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ بہت خوش قسمت تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Bahut Khush Qismat Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The poet reflects on the nature of waiting and hope.

TITLE_UR: قریب آؤ کہ ہم تم سے پیار کر لیں
TITLE_EN: Qareeb Aao Ke Hum Tum Se Pyaar Kar Lein
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A passionate ghazal about the urgency of love and the omnipresence of the beloved's image. The poet sees the beloved's reflection everywhere.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے ہو تو رات ڈھل گئی ہے
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye Ho To Raat Dhal Gayi Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the arrival of the beloved and the fulfillment of longing. Represents the theme of union (wasl) in Faiz's poetry.

TITLE_UR: یوں ہی انتظار کا موسم نہیں گزرتا
TITLE_EN: Yun Hi Intezar Ka Mausam Nahin Guzarta
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the heaviness of silence and the need for a confidant. The poet struggles to find someone to share his heart's condition.

TITLE_UR: ہم پہ اب بھی ہے اس کی مہربانی
TITLE_EN: Hum Pe Ab Bhi Hai Uski Mehrbani
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the bittersweet nature of memory when the beloved no longer comes. The poet finds solace in the fact that she still comes to mind at night.

TITLE_UR: وہ بات سارے فسانے میں جس کا ذکر نہ تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Baat Sare Fasanay Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love and the mystery of attachment. The poet questions why the heart remains attached despite everything.

TITLE_UR: ہم دیکھیں گے
TITLE_EN: Hum Dekhenge
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Zia-era protest poem (1979)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Faiz's most famous revolutionary poem, written as a protest song during Zia-ul-Haq's regime. It became an anthem of resistance and is still recited at political rallies in Pakistan and India. The Atlantic featured an article on its historical significance in 2013.

TITLE_UR: لہو کا سراغ
TITLE_EN: Lahu Ka Suragh
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Sar-e-Wadi-e-Sina (1971)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A poem about the search for justice and the passage of difficult times, from the collection 'Sar-e-Wadi-e-Sina' (1971). Reflects the pain of political oppression and the hope for change.

TITLE_UR: ظلمت کدہ
TITLE_EN: Zulmat Kadah
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the duality of existence - darkness and light, pain and hope. Represents Faiz's philosophical depth and his ability to find light in darkness.

TITLE_UR: جلوۂ یار
TITLE_EN: Jalwa-e-Yaar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the search for divine beauty and the persistence of love despite failure. The poet continues to call out the beloved's name, reflecting Sufi influences.

TITLE_UR: آئینہ دکھائیے
TITLE_EN: Aaina Dikhayiye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring self-reflection and the paradox of finding the beloved in one's own image. The poet cannot bear to look at himself in the mirror, a theme echoing classical Persian poetry.

TITLE_UR: کبھی کبھی کوئی خواب آنکھوں میں رہ جاتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Kabhi Kabhi Koi Khwab Aankhon Mein Reh Jata Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about dreams that persist and words that leave lasting impressions. The contrast between spring and autumn imagery reflects the beloved's presence and absence.

TITLE_UR: دل کو ترستے ہی رہنا ہے ترستے ہی رہو
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Taraste Hi Rehna Hai Taraste Hi Raho
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about perpetual longing and waiting that becomes a way of life. The repetition of 'رہو' emphasizes the endless nature of waiting. From Faiz's middle period.

TITLE_UR: یہی زندگی ہے تو کیا زندگی
TITLE_EN: Yahi Zindagi Hai To Kya Zindagi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal questioning the meaning of life without love or memory of the beloved. The radif 'زندگی' emphasizes the central theme. Represents Faiz's later philosophical period.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے تو کہا تھا زندگی مل گئی
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye To Kaha Tha Zindagi Mil Gayi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about finding life in the beloved's presence and solace in their memory. The radif 'گئی' creates a sense of completion and finality. Features the famous line about pleasure in heart's burning.

TITLE_UR: رات بھر دیکھتے رہے ان کو
TITLE_EN: Raat Bhar Dekhte Rahe Un Ko
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about watching the beloved all night, oblivious to time passing. The moon imagery represents the beloved's beauty. From Faiz's romantic period.

TITLE_UR: وہ آتے تو کہتے کہ دل ہے نہیں
TITLE_EN: Wo Aate To Kahte Ke Dil Hai Nahin
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the mystery of the beloved's indifference and hidden feelings. The beloved both settles in eyes and descends into heart, creating a paradox of presence and absence.

TITLE_UR: دل کی بات کہیں تک نہ گئی
TITLE_EN: Dil Ki Baat Kahin Tak Na Gayi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about unexpressed feelings and the endless waiting for the beloved. The radif 'گئی' emphasizes things that remain unfinished. Features the theme of life passing in anticipation.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید کبھی خوابوں میں ملیں
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad Kabhi Khwabon Mein Milein
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The opening line 'اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید کبھی خوابوں میں ملیں' is one of Faiz's most quoted verses. The imagery of dried flowers in books is particularly poignant.

TITLE_UR: ہم جو بھی ہیں تمہارے ہیں
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Bhi Hain Tumhare Hain
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about complete belonging to the beloved and the mystery of their hidden feelings. The radif 'ہے' creates a sense of present truth. Features the theme of the beloved's image descending into the heart.

TITLE_UR: اب تو عادت سی ہے مجھ کو
TITLE_EN: Ab To Aadat Si Hai Mujh Ko
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the habit of smiling in grief and the constant presence of the beloved's memory in both loneliness and gatherings. The theme of silent communication is particularly striking.

TITLE_UR: یہ جو ایک شمع جلتی ہے
TITLE_EN: Ye Jo Ek Shamma Jalti Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal using the candle as a metaphor for the waiting heart, burning with hope. The radif 'ہے' emphasizes the present continuous state. Classical imagery adapted to modern sensibility.

TITLE_UR: کچھ اس کی یاد نے ایسے گھیرا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Uski Yaad Ne Aise Ghera
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about how the beloved's memory consumes all other thoughts and makes the world meaningless without them. The heart remains lost in her words even when she is gone.

TITLE_UR: وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Hum Nahin Jo Pehle Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about transformation through suffering and the impossibility of finding anyone like the beloved. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past state. Features the famous line about the heart enduring a thousand sorrows.

TITLE_UR: چاندنی رات میں تنہا
TITLE_EN: Chandni Raat Mein Tanha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the burden of memory in moonlit nights and the torment of love. Moon imagery enhances the romantic melancholy. From Faiz's early to middle period.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا مگر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Magar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the habit of smiling through grief. Despite distraction, memory returns. The paradox of living without truly living is explored.

TITLE_UR: اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
TITLE_EN: Ab Kisi Ke Gham Mein Jalna Kya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a single call that promised life and the suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper. The theme of hidden feelings recurs throughout Faiz's work.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Ek Baar Mil Gaya Tha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a significant meeting that defines what meeting means, and how grief increases when expected to decrease. The beloved will be remembered even after death.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference and the heart's eternal dissatisfaction despite all experience. Both meeting and departure were significant.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the power of a single glance to erase sorrow and the habit of smiling in grief. The heart eternally watches the same path, a recurring theme in Faiz's poetry.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the final state of knowing nothing at all except the beloved's thought. Represents Faiz's later, more meditative style.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the heart's obsession and the beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises. The dilemma of whether to love again is poignantly expressed.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought, and the torment of dreams where the heart turns against itself. Questions what was gained from a life of love.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو ہم سے مل کر مسکرائے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Hum Se Mil Kar Muskurae Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about an enduring smile that remains in memory, and the state of not wanting to meet even oneself. Love becomes the only remaining routine, a theme that resonates throughout Faiz's work.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کی یاد آئی تو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ki Yaad Aai To
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a day lost entirely to memory, and the question of whose memory consumed Faiz's days. The significance of that one meeting is emphasized. A fitting conclusion to this collection of ghazals.

TITLE_UR: دل ناشاد کو تجھ سے کوئی امید نہیں
TITLE_EN: Dil-e-Nashad Ko Tujh Se Koi Umeed Nahi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about hopeless hope. The radif 'نہیں' emphasizes absence and negation. From Faiz's middle period where philosophical themes began to dominate.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ کہاں گئے جو کہتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Kahan Gaye Jo Kehte Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about those who promised to search but themselves got lost. The theme of disappearance and loss reflects Faiz's experience with friends and comrades who were imprisoned or disappeared.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو سب ہیں غم زدہ لیکن
TITLE_EN: Yun To Sab Hain Gham-zada Lekin
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal distinguishing between ordinary grief and the beloved's grief that penetrates deeper. The imagery of grief flowing from eyes versus remaining in eyes is particularly striking.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم نے سوچا ہے
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Ne Socha Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the conflict between decision and emotion. The theme of silence being heavy is a recurring motif in Faiz's later work.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو دن میں بھی اندھیرا ہوتا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Din Mein Bhi Andhera Hota
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal wishing for darkness to escape memories. The theme of life passing in waiting is central to Faiz's poetic vision.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھا کر یہ کہا کرتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjha Kar Ye Kaha Karte Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a single call that promised life. The suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper is explored. From Faiz's middle period.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Ek Baar Mil Gaya Tha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a significant meeting that defines what meeting means. The beloved will be remembered even after death. Grief increases when expected to decrease.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the heart's obsession. The beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises is a classic Faiz motif.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference and the heart's eternal dissatisfaction despite all experience.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought, and the torment of dreams where the heart turns against itself.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Woh Bhool Gaye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the irony of assuming the beloved has forgotten when she actually remembers. Life's constant state remains unchanged.

TITLE_UR: ہم سے جو بات کہی تم نے سن لی ہم نے
TITLE_EN: Hum Se Jo Baat Kahi Tum Ne Sun Li Hum Ne
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about words that are heard and cherished in the heart. The radif 'نے' emphasizes the agency of both speaker and listener. From Faiz's later period.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو ہر چہرہ پہ اجنبیت چھائی ہے
TITLE_EN: Yun To Har Chehra Pe Ajnabiyat Chhayi Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the beloved's face being the only one not strange in a world where every face is covered with strangeness. The theme of alienation is prominent.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے چاہا تو بہت پر نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Chaha To Bahut Par Na Mila
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the grief of forgetting and the paradoxical pleasure found in the heart's burning. The theme of fate and destiny is explored.

TITLE_UR: یوں نہیں کہ اس کا غم کم ہو گیا
TITLE_EN: Yun Nahin Ke Uss Ka Gham Kam Ho Gaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about how grief becomes habitual, and the desolation of paths once walked together. The radif 'گیا' creates a sense of transformation and loss.

TITLE_UR: اب تو گزرے دن بھی یاد نہیں
TITLE_EN: Ab To Guzray Din Bhi Yaad Nahin
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the erasure of both past and future from memory, leaving only a heavy silence. The radif 'نہیں' emphasizes complete negation. Represents Faiz's late style.

TITLE_UR: کچھ نہیں تو یہ دل ہے
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Nahin To Ye Dil Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the preciousness of the heart. The theme of total sacrifice for the beloved is central. The final couplet questions what Faiz gained from his devotion.

TITLE_UR: اب اس کے بعد کس سے ملیے
TITLE_EN: Ab Uss Ke Baad Kis Se Miliye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about seeing the beloved's reflection everywhere after separation. The theme of the beloved's omnipresence is central. From Faiz's later period.

TITLE_UR: وہ بات سارے فسانے میں جس کا ذکر نہ تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Baat Sare Fasanay Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love. The thing not mentioned becomes most significant. The theme of hidden feelings is prominent.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے مانا کہ تم سے کچھ نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Mana Ke Tum Se Kuchh Na Mila
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about finding pleasure in desire itself, even when unfulfilled. The equation of the world's sorrow with the beloved's sorrow is a key theme.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ بہت خوش قسمت تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Bahut Khush Qismat Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past state and lost opportunity.

TITLE_UR: قریب آؤ کہ ہم تم سے پیار کر لیں
TITLE_EN: Qareeb Aao Ke Hum Tum Se Pyaar Kar Lein
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A passionate ghazal about the urgency of love. The theme of the beloved's image appearing on every face after separation is striking.

TITLE_UR: یوں ہی انتظار کا موسم نہیں گزرتا
TITLE_EN: Yun Hi Intezar Ka Mausam Nahin Guzarta
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the heaviness of silence and the need for a confidant. The heart's words cannot be shared with anyone.

TITLE_UR: ہم پہ اب بھی ہے اس کی مہربانی
TITLE_EN: Hum Pe Ab Bhi Hai Uski Mehrbani
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the bittersweet nature of memory when the beloved no longer comes. The heart becomes accustomed to absence.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The imagery of dried flowers in books is iconic in Urdu poetry.

TITLE_UR: وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Hum Nahin Jo Pehle Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about transformation through suffering. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past state and lost identity. The heart endures a thousand sorrows.

TITLE_UR: اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
TITLE_EN: Ab Kisi Ke Gham Mein Jalna Kya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about a single call that promised life. The suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper is explored. A recurring theme in Faiz's poetry.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the transformative power of a single glance. The habit of smiling in grief becomes a defining characteristic of the lover.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the persistence of memory. The final state of knowing nothing at all except the beloved's thought reflects Faiz's later philosophical period.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the heart's obsession. The beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises is classic Faiz.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought. The torment of dreams where the heart wishes never to wake is a powerful theme.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference. The heart's eternal dissatisfaction despite all experience is explored.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the power of a single glance to erase sorrow. The heart eternally watches the same path, waiting.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the persistence of memory. Words once spoken remain eternal. The final state of knowing nothing at all is poignant.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا تھا کچھ دیر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Tha Kuchh Der
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the cycle of distraction and return to memory. The beloved becomes omnipresent, dwelling in the eyes.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Woh Bhool Gaye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the irony of assuming the beloved has forgotten when she actually remembers. Life's constant state remains unchanged, a theme that resonates throughout Faiz's work.
